# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F
import triton
import triton.language as tl

@triton.jit
def channel_shuffle_kernel(
    input_ptr,
    output_ptr,
    batch_size,
    channels,
    groups,
    height,
    width,
    BLOCK_W: tl.constexpr
):
    # 3D grid dimensions
    pid_n = tl.program_id(0)
    pid_gh = tl.program_id(1)
    pid_w_block = tl.program_id(2)
    
    channels_per_group = channels // groups
    group_stride = channels_per_group * height
    
    # Decompose pid_gh into group/channel/height indices
    pid_group = pid_gh // group_stride
    remainder = pid_gh % group_stride
    pid_channel_in_group = remainder // height
    pid_h = remainder % height
    
    # Width offsets for this block
    off_w = pid_w_block * BLOCK_W + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_W)
    mask = off_w < width
    
    # Calculate input offset - coalesced access pattern
    input_offset = (
        pid_n * channels * height * width +
        (pid_group * channels_per_group + pid_channel_in_group) * height * width +
        pid_h * width +
        off_w
    )
    x = tl.load(input_ptr + input_offset, mask=mask)
    
    # Permute channel index
    output_channel = pid_channel_in_group * groups + pid_group
    output_offset = (
        pid_n * channels * height * width +
        output_channel * height * width +
        pid_h * width +
        off_w
    )
    tl.store(output_ptr + output_offset, x, mask=mask)

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, groups=3):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        assert out_channels % 4 == 0
        mid_channels = out_channels // 4
        
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, mid_channels, kernel_size=1, stride=1, padding=0, groups=groups, bias=False)
        self.bn1 = nn.BatchNorm2d(mid_channels)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(mid_channels, mid_channels, kernel_size=3, stride=1, padding=1, groups=mid_channels, bias=False)
        self.bn2 = nn.BatchNorm2d(mid_channels)
        self.conv3 = nn.Conv2d(mid_channels, out_channels, kernel_size=1, stride=1, padding=0, groups=groups, bias=False)
        self.bn3 = nn.BatchNorm2d(out_channels)
        self.groups = groups
        
        if in_channels == out_channels:
            self.shortcut = nn.Sequential()
        else:
            self.shortcut = nn.Sequential(
                nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size=1, stride=1, padding=0, bias=False),
                nn.BatchNorm2d(out_channels)
            )
    
    def forward(self, x):
        out = F.relu(self.bn1(self.conv1(x)))
        out = self.bn2(self.conv2(out))
        
        # Channel shuffle with optimized Triton kernel
        batch_size, channels, height, width = out.shape
        out = out.contiguous()
        output = torch.empty_like(out)
        groups = self.groups
        channels_per_group = channels // groups
        
        # Configure kernel with optimized grid layout
        BLOCK_W = 128
        grid = (
            batch_size,
            groups * channels_per_group * height,
            triton.cdiv(width, BLOCK_W)
        )
        
        channel_shuffle_kernel[grid](
            out, output, 
            batch_size, channels, groups, height, width,
            BLOCK_W=BLOCK_W
        )
        out = output
        
        out = F.relu(self.bn3(self.conv3(out)))
        out += self.shortcut(x)
        return out
    
batch_size = 10
input_channels = 240
out_channels = 480
groups = 3
height = 224
width = 224
num_classes = 1000

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(batch_size, input_channels, height, width)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [input_channels, out_channels, groups]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
